name: Ubud
fun_fact: Fun fact: Ubud's name comes from the word 'ubad' meaning medicine - the town was historically known for its healing herbs and spiritual healers, making it Bali's center for traditional medicine and spirituality!

hero_dishes.name: Babi Guling
hero_dishes.description: Whole roasted suckling pig stuffed with traditional spices, turmeric, and lemongrass
hero_dishes.origin_story: Originally reserved for ceremonies and temple offerings, now Bali's most famous dish. The pig is spit-roasted for hours until the skin is perfectly crispy
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Ibu Oka (Anthony Bourdain favorite near Ubud Palace), Babi Guling Pak Malen

hero_dishes.name: Bebek Betutu
hero_dishes.description: Duck stuffed with traditional spices, wrapped in banana leaves, slow-cooked for 12+ hours
hero_dishes.origin_story: A ceremonial dish requiring intensive preparation, traditionally cooked overnight in rice husks. The spice paste (betutu) is a closely guarded family secret
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bebek Bengil (Dirty Duck Diner), Bebek Tepi Sawah with rice paddy views

hero_dishes.name: Lawar
hero_dishes.description: Finely chopped meat, vegetables, grated coconut, and spices mixed with fresh pig blood
hero_dishes.origin_story: An ancient Balinese dish served at ceremonies, the blood is believed to add vitality and is considered sacred
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional warungs in Ubud Market area, ceremony days throughout Ubud

hero_dishes.name: Nasi Campur Bali
hero_dishes.description: Mixed rice plate with small portions of various Balinese dishes
hero_dishes.origin_story: The daily meal of Balinese people - each warung has their own combination of accompaniments
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Warung Biah Biah, Murni's Warung, local warungs throughout Ubud

signature_drinks.name: Kopi Luwak
signature_drinks.description: World's most expensive coffee made from beans eaten and excreted by civet cats
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Strong and black in small cups - Ubud is surrounded by plantations where you can try it ethically sourced

signature_drinks.name: Jamu
signature_drinks.description: Traditional Javanese herbal medicine drink made with turmeric, ginger, tamarind
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Ubud is famous for jamu healers - drink fresh from local vendors for health and vitality

food_culture_notes: Warungs (family-run eateries) serve the most authentic food at extremely low prices
Balinese eat with their right hand traditionally - the left hand is considered unclean
Food offerings (canang sari) are placed everywhere daily - never step on them
Many dishes feature sambal matah - raw shallot and lemongrass relish unique to Bali
